Adversaries.Alerting_Strategy: Events that are deemed to be abnormal or potentially malicious are assigned appropriate severity values (Info, Low, Medium, High, Severe, Critical). These detections are also enriched with contextual information, such as a short description and potential mapping(s) to related ATT&CK Tactics and Techniques. Detections are aggregated (and assigned a composite severity value) into specific views as well as highlighted (with specific icons and fonts) when included as part of other views of system events/data.
Adversaries.Correlation_Strategy: Detection views capture correlation between system events and data, such as process lineage, interactions between processes and files or network sockets. Each detection focuses on one or more relevant hosts, and includes specific summary, process tree, and log views. Broad context detection views exist to provide a wider perspective on events across multiple hosts.
